scenarioDescription:
The HD 114729 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 114729 is a star with 0.94 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.47 times its radius. It is located 123.31 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.116 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 114729 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 114729 system


HD 114729 b

HD 114729 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2003-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 114729 b is 262.350 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 114729 b is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 114729 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 114729, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 114729 - System With 1 Exoplanet
